name: Islamic Foundation of Nevada
mission: TO PROVICDE A HIGH QUALITY OF EDUCATION TO ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY SCHOOL CHILDREN AND TO PROVIDE THE LOCAL COMMUNITY A BURIAL PLACE TO PRACTICE TRADIT...
theoryOfChange: By investing in educational access (scholarships) and leadership development (Cotillion/mentoring), the foundation aims to create a lasting impact for generations and build a more equitable community.
zakatClaimEvidence: No explicit mention of zakat acceptance or dedicated zakat funds/campaigns found for Islamic Foundation of Nevada in the search results. Information found regarding 'Islamic Foundation' (with email zakat@ifsvp.org) and 'Islamic Society of Nevada' refers to different entities. (Source: https://ifnv.org/donate)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

all_citations.claim: The organization reports a 75.5% program expense ratio, $3,248,200 in total revenue, and 31.4 months of working capital.
The foundation operates educational programs, the Cooley-Moore Scholarship Luncheon, and the Cotillion Leadership Program.
The organization provides various donation options for community members to contribute charitable gifts.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its solid financial health and high program spending, though its alignment score is tempered by limited data on specific donor fit metrics.
areas_for_improvement: Limited external data regarding specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics
Opportunity to enhance public transparency regarding long-term impact data

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization serves as a religious and cultural hub for the Nevada community, offering sadaqah-eligible giving opportunities to support its mission [3]. While it maintains a consistent track record in local leadership and education, the alignment score reflects a medium donor fit due to the specific regional focus of its programs [1][2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates high organizational capacity, allocating 75.5% of its $3,248,200 total revenue directly to its educational and community programs [1][2]. With 31.4 months of working capital, the organization maintains a strong financial buffer to ensure the continuity of its elementary and secondary school services [1].

The foundation demonstrates exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of <cite id="7">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>.
Founded in <cite id="3">2001</cite>, the organization has a long-standing track record of providing educational and religious services to the community.

strengths_deep_dive: The Islamic Foundation of Nevada has established a solid financial foundation to support its mission. The organization reported <cite id="1">$3,248,200 in total revenue</cite> for 2023, representing a <cite id="8">31.7% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>. This financial stability is further evidenced by its <cite id="6">31.4 months of working capital</cite>, ensuring the organization can weather economic fluctuations while continuing to provide essential services like the <cite id="4">Cooley-Moore Scholarship Luncheon</cite> and <cite id="5">Cotillion Leadership Program</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The Islamic Foundation of Nevada serves the local community through comprehensive educational programming and essential religious services. The organization reported <cite id="1">$3,248,200 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year, with a <cite id="2">75.5% program expense ratio</cite>. Founded in <cite id="3">2001</cite>, the foundation provides a range of programs including the <cite id="4">Cooley-Moore Scholarship Luncheon Fashion Show</cite> and the <cite id="5">Cotillion Leadership Program</cite>. The organization maintains strong financial liquidity with <cite id="6">31.4 months of working capital available</cite> and demonstrates high fundraising efficiency with a cost of <cite id="7">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>.
